welcome-screen.no-completed: You do not have any completed examinations yet.
welcome-screen.tap-to-start: Tap here to start a new one

begin-examination.title: Information
begin-examination.text-1: The examination is a mix of questions and tasks to complete.
begin-examination.text-2: The following will be necessary in order to complete the examination:
begin-examination.text-3: 1. A needle or a safety pin.
begin-examination.text-4: 2. That you can get to bare skin on your feet and up to slightly past the knee, for example by taking off socks and rolling up pants.

symptoms.title: General symptoms
symptoms.text-1: In your day-to-day life, do you notice any symptoms in your legs or feet?
symptoms.text-2: Examples of symptoms are numbness, pain, or other unexpected sensations.

prick-info.title: Prick test
prick-info.text-1: On the following pages you will test the pin-prick sensitivity of your legs using a needle or a safety pin.
prick-info.text-2: Your prick sensitivity is determined by comparing the sensitivity of a specified area on your leg with the area around the clavicle ("the reference area").
prick-info.text-3: Make sure to prick on bare skin.

prick-test.text-1: 1: Prick multiple spots in the reference area.
prick-test.text-2-toe: 2: Prick multiple spots on top of the toes.
prick-test.text-2-foot: 2: Prick multiple spots on top of the foot.
prick-test.text-2-leg: 2: Prick multiple spots in the blue area on the outside of the leg.
prick-test.text-3-toe: How sensitive are the toes compared to the reference area? Only compare the sharpness of the prick sensation, not touch.
prick-test.text-3-foot: How sensitive is the foot compared to the reference area? Only compare the sharpness of the prick sensation, not touch.
prick-test.text-3-leg: How sensitive is the area on the leg compared to the reference area? Only compare the sharpness of the prick sensation, not touch.
prick-test.bottom-sheet-text-1: Answer SAME if the area on the leg is about as sensitive to pricking as the reference area (or more).
prick-test.bottom-sheet-text-2: Answer LESS if the area is less sensitive, but you can still feel the prick.
prick-test.bottom-sheet-text-3: Answer NONE if you don't feel the prick in the area.

pricking-warning.title: Remember!
pricking-warning.info: Prick gently, to feel the sharpness, but not to break the skin!

allodynia.text: During the pin-prick examination, did you feel increased pain from pricking in the foot or toes?

hypersensitivity.text: Do you experience discomfort or pain when touching the foot or toes?

pain-skip.title: Are you experiencing pain in your feet?

pain-0.title: On the scale below, mark your pain level.

pain-1.title: Does your pain present one or more of the following characteristics?

pain-2.title: In the same area, is your pain associated to one or more symptoms?

pain-3.title: Is the pain located in an area where the examination unveiled:

pain-4.title-1: Use your fingers to gently stroke the areas where the pain is present.
pain-4.title-2: Is the pain provoked or increased by the stroking?

vibration-info.title: Vibration Test
vibration-info.text-1: This begins the vibration sensation test.
vibration-info.text-2: You will test three points on each leg.
vibration-info.text-3: When pressing the phone to your leg, use the backside of the phone.
vibration-info.text-4: Make sure to do the test agains bare skin.

vibration-toe.text: Press start to start vibrating, and press the backside of the phone firmly against the top side of the bone in your great toe.

vibration-ankle.text: Press start to start vibrating, and press the backside of the phone firmly against the outside part of your ankle.

vibration-knee.text: Press start to start vibrating, and press the backside of the phone firmly against the bone just below your kneecap.

extension.text-2-left: Grab your left great toe with your fingers and move it up and down a couple of times.
extension.text-2-right: Grab your right great toe with your fingers and move it up and down a couple of times.
extension.text-3: Can you feel the movement in the joints?
extension.bottom-sheet-text-1: The feeling of movement is not a feeling of touch.
extension.bottom-sheet-text-2: If you only feel your hand's grip, answer NO to this question.
extension.bottom-sheet-text-3: If you don't have symptoms in your hands, you can compare how your fingers feel when moved.

motor-info.title: Motor examination
motor-info.text-1: Here you will test the strength of your great toes.
motor-info.text-2: The great toe can usually resist a lot of pressure. In the test press down the great toe with your fingers while resisting the pressure.

motor-test.text-1: Apply firm pressure with your fingers to the great toe.
motor-test.text-2: Is it difficult for the toe to overcome the pressure?
motor-test.bottom-sheet-text-1: If you don't have symptoms in your hands, you can compare how your fingers overcome the pressure.
motor-test.bottom-sheet-text-2: If you feel your great toe is weaker, answer YES to this question.

free-text.title: Closing comments
free-text.text: Do you have any thought or comments that weren't addressed in the examination? If so, please write them below.

examination-completed-text: Tap DONE to finish and see the result

result-screen.title: Examination completed
result-screen.text-2: The score reflects the severity of your symptoms and findings during the examination (the lower the score is, the better).
result-screen.text-3: You should not conclude on any diagnosis without seeing a health professional.

delete-database.title: Delete database
delete-database.text: Are you sure you want to delete the database? This will delete all your data and cannot be undone.
